title: Presidential Cruises Are a Thing of the Past
sub_head: The SS Wilson was sold in 1973 and rechristened the Oriental Empress.
body:
It may not be the most dramatic question in our politically divided times, but as a measure of where we find ourselves now it is perhaps worth pondering: Will there ever again be an ocean liner or cruise ship named for a U.S. president?
There donâ€™t seem to be any today and not to have been any for almost 50 years. But until the 1970s such ships proudly advertised themselves to world travelers, confident that the dignity and stature of a presidential name would be great for business.
